title: Static friction - friction on a pulled bag

content.question: A child pulls a strap on a <math alttext="5.0 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> bag at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Â°</mi></math> to the horizontal with a force of <math alttext="26 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>26</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> as it rests on a rough wooden floor, as shown. The child is unable to get the bag to slide. The magnitude of the force of friction between the bag and floor is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
